meanings.definition: An act of turning or changing direction.
meanings.sent1: The sudden turnabout of the car surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: I made a quick turnabout to avoid the obstacle.
meanings.sent3: The turnabout of the compass needle was quite unexpected.
meanings.sent4: Her mood had a complete turnabout after the good news.
meanings.sent5: The turnabout in the road led us to a beautiful view.

meanings.definition: A complete change in opinion or behavior.
meanings.sent1: His turnabout on the issue shocked his friends.
meanings.sent2: After the argument, there was a noticeable turnabout in her attitude.
meanings.sent3: The turnabout in his taste for music was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her turnabout in political beliefs was like a sudden storm.
meanings.sent5: The turnabout in his behavior was hard to ignore.

meanings.definition: A reversal of a situation or decision.
meanings.sent1: The unexpected turnabout in the court case changed everything.
meanings.sent2: The turnabout in the game's outcome left the fans in disbelief.
meanings.sent3: The turnabout in the weather forecast made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The turnabout in the negotiations caught everyone off guard.
meanings.sent5: The turnabout in the stock market was quite dramatic.
